location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: File 442/1907 'Persian Gulf: British and German shipping; German competition'

physicalDescription.extent: Foliation: the foliation sequence commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 220; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The volume contains letters and other papers, mainly by British Consular officials, reporting on the issue of competition from German shipping, 1907-1911.Included are a number of reports with statistical tables:List of cargo shipped per SS Canadia from Antwerp (14 July) and Hamburg (16 July);Report on trade done by Hamburg-American line with Basra (with four annexes of statistical tables) compiled by F E Crow, Consul, Basra;Proposed state aid to British shipping companies in the Gulf;Difficulties concerning lighterage at Bahrain.

name.namePart: Secretary of State for India, United Kingdom
